description: archaeological site with cloud-covered mountain peaks in background; excavated walls in front with wide steps in middle ground
marks: Signature; Edition in pencil, below image: [4/60 Edward Ranney]
text: Edward Ranney is a contemporary photographer of cultural sites, especially those in Peru and the southwest United States. Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inka site located nearly 8,000 feet above sea level northwest of the Peruvian city of Cuzco. The exact purpose of Machu Picchu is still debated among archeologists and historians, but it is generally considered a royal retreat site for the emperor of the Inka and his royal court.
title: Upper Macchu Picchu, Looking South
